title: Virtual Simulation-Based Medical Civic Education for Training Basic Life Support (BLS) Professionals: Strengthening Community Safety

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic principles of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), experience in responding to emergency situations, and foundational knowledge of community health safety systems and citizens' rights
context.additional_context: Non-degree professional training program combining virtual lab environments with field training. Aims to enhance citizens' rights and strengthen public health safety, with culturally and institutionally contextualized curriculum design.

learning_goals: Learners secure the ability to perform immediate emergency measures within 10 seconds of a cardiac arrest scenario in a virtual simulation, enhancing public safety awareness and rights.
Learners apply CPR (30:2 compression-to-ventilation ratio) standard protocols with â‰¥80% accuracy, strengthening medical protocol adherence and understanding of community health safety systems.
Learners demonstrate AED usage procedures without errors in 3 consecutive trials, contributing to community health safety networks and citizen engagement activation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
